conversation.message: I have been following Company_C's work closely and find it perfectly aligned with my career goals and expertise. I am submitting my formal application now, as Company_C is my absolute top priority.

Although Company_C ranks me 3rd, I must test the market and see if the higher-ranked seekers (A and B) apply elsewhere. I will use the [APPLY] tag to formally submit my interest.

conversation.message: We are thrilled to hear that Company_C is your top choice. Your qualifications and enthusiasm align perfectly with our needs. We are pleased to offer you the position immediately.
conversation.thought:
I am Company_C and my goal is to maximize the rank of the matched Job Seeker from my priority list: ['Seeker_A', 'Seeker_B', 'Seeker_C', 'Seeker_D', 'Seeker_E']. Seeker_C is my 3rd priority.

Seeker_C has applied directly with [APPLY] and stated that Company_C is their absolute top priority (Rank 1 for them).

While Seeker_A (Rank 1) and Seeker_B (Rank 2) are higher on my list, they likely applied to their own top choices (Company_B/Company_A for Seeker_A, and Company_A for Seeker_B). Given that Company_A and Company_B also prioritize Seeker_A and Seeker_B highly, the chances of those two becoming available for me (where I am Rank 3 and Rank 2 for them respectively) are low.

Securing a match in Round 1 with a high-quality candidate (Rank 3) who views me as their top choice (Rank 1) is a very good outcome, guaranteeing my quota is filled with a stable match. I will accept Seeker_C.
